page.title: 17Local village events
page.content: On Saturday June 29th 1985, Lastingham & Spaunton joined together in celebrating the{100th aniversary}of the village school,which is now used as the village hall. The residents of the two villages provided food for a fabulous buffet supper which included a huge fruit cake. This was cut by our eldest resident who was 91 years old. Several attended in victorian costume & many guests were former residents who had moved away in recent years. This was one of the many social events when all the villagers with differing lifestyles & attitudes joined together on an equal footing to celebrate a special event. Perhaps this would not have been possible in the days when the school was built.
